title: 10.2 Linked Lists
content:
Section 10.2

Linked Lists

Summary

Elements connected by pointers, supporting efficient insertion/deletion.

Key Points

  • Each element has key and next pointer (and prev for doubly-linked)
  • Search: O(n) - must traverse from head
  • Insert/Delete at known position: O(1) with pointer manipulation
  • Singly-linked: next only. Doubly-linked: next and prev
  • Circular: tail points to head

Pseudocode

LIST-INSERT(L, x):
    x.next = L.head
    if L.head ≠ NIL:
        L.head.prev = x
    L.head = x
    x.prev = NIL

LIST-DELETE(L, x):
    if x.prev ≠ NIL:
        x.prev.next = x.next
    else: L.head = x.next
    if x.next ≠ NIL:
        x.next.prev = x.prev

Why It Matters

When frequent insertions/deletions needed without reallocation.
